newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: Tanganyika issues shares to Anglo.
newsitem.headline: Tanganyika issues shares to Anglo.

text.p: Gold explorer Tanganyika Gold NL said on Tuesday it plans to make a placement of 12 million shares to Anglo American Corp of South Africa Ltd at a price of 60 cents per share.
Tanganyika said Anglo American had also acquired 5.86 million Tanganyika shares on-market on Tuesday.
Tanganyika shares closed steady at 46 cents with 8.56 million shares traded.
It said the issue and on-market purchases would give Anglo American a 14.9 percent stake in Tanganyika.
Tanganyika said it also proposed that Anglo-American would be granted six million options exercisable at 85 cents per share by June 30, 1998.

It said the funds from the placement would be used to further expand the company's exploration activities in Tanzania, and to ensure that it was well placed to take full advantage of its substantial tenement holdings and priority drilling targets.
Tanganyika and Anglo-American are partners in the Samena joint venture in the Geita goldfield in Tanzania.
